H0.text: Flourine, Bromine, Iodine and Chlorine are all what type of elements. Halogen

H1.text: Flourine, Bromine, Iodine and Chlorine are all what type of elements. Noble Gas

H2.text: Flourine, Bromine, Iodine and Chlorine are all what type of elements. Metalloid

H3.text: Flourine, Bromine, Iodine and Chlorine are all what type of elements. Dihalo

A4.text: The halogens () are a group in the periodic table consisting of six chemically related elements: fluorine (F), chlorine (Cl), bromine (Br), iodine (I), and the radioactive elements astatine (At) and tennessine (Ts), though some authors would exclude tennessine as its chemistry is unknown and is theoretically expected to be more like that of gallium.

A5.text: The word 'halogen' means 'salt former' or 'salt maker'. When halogens react with metals, they produce a wide range of salts, including calcium fluoride, sodium chloride (common table salt), silver bromide, and potassium iodide.
